intro: Faramea oxyclada, commonly known as the African hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Faramea oxyclada is also valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional uses in some cultures.
